data.text: @StephenPunwasi Elevators and poverty don't make for a healthy mix.
@StephenPunwasi Damn, I'm grateful to live in a country that can put together this complex data in a digestible format for people like me. 😂🤦‍♂️
@StephenPunwasi It's all about recycled air in those old buildings. Covid is airborne. New building will need HEPA or MERV 13 filtration. Otherwise they are death traps.
@StephenPunwasi What exactly are we supposed to do with this extremely useful data?
@StephenPunwasi So no study to for income or private insurance that is more relevant?

@Flagpole_Canada haha. It's a pretty perplexing little detail, isn't it? 

I'm assuming they didn't correct for location. If you're a low income person living in a single-family home in the middle of nowhere in Newfoundland, your odds of getting sick from COVID are pretty slim.
@StephenPunwasi So Ur just quoting batman movies now & calling it ur opinion?
@StephenPunwasi Yup Stephen, Always look at the bright side.. but unfortunately as they become vacant the rent also gets higher
@StephenPunwasi I guess the lower mortality rate for “low income” in a single family detached was due to fortunes kept from the CRA overseas and/or inherited wealth?
